root: ^<I>Life really couldn't be much better, A healthy family, a good job, a comfortable home.
^<I>I spend my days working with my wife and see my friends often.
^<I>You know what is even better? She's heading straight for the top!
^No better woman for it either and I get to be the lucky fella who gets to tell everyone-
^<I> It's what she's always wanted and I get to support her. I never had big plans, or ambitions like her.
^<I> She's amazing that way. Built for it, unlike myself.
^<I> I stare down at the documents on the desk, debating looking through them. I had some concerns to discuss with the Chief but... she seems to be out.
^<I> I'm not really supposed to be in here... surely she'd understand.

inspect: ^<I> Unable to curb my curiousity I have a look through the documents strewn across her desk.
^<I> ...I stare down at them in shock, mother of God.
trust: ^<I> I can't simply refile through my bosses belongings! That's absurd!
^ ...I stare down at them none the less as the title of one of the papers catches my eye.
OhNo: ^<I> It's all fake. Forgeries, copies of statements with large sums removed, hostile letters,photos of my coworkers families.
^<I>Each one had a name or face attachted that I knew, I knew them all so well.
^<I> Before I know it I'm digging through drawer after drawer.
^ ...Even my own name, my wifes name and a picture of our daughter.I don't know whether to scream in anger or grief. The door cracks open.
^"May I ask what brings you to my office today?"
^ I freeze, dropping whatever is in my hands. I had forgotten myself, forgotten my place, forgotten my purpose. I turn around
two: ^ I can't look her in the eye, she can see right through me. I feel sick enough as it is. I can't bare to meet her gaze after what I've seen.
four: ^<I>I look her dead in the eye, It's intimdating...far more than it's ever been.
^...I avert my gaze soon after, she's far too intense.
Continue: ^"Find what you were looking for did you?" <I> Her smile is unsettling.
^I feel as though I should run but my legs refuse to move. I can't run, this is all far too much. She moves closer, I hear a click.
^"Boy, If you know what's good for you, you'll pretend you saw nothing here...I wasn't here and you left."
^I can't do that, she's not helping anyone, it's all a set up. It's all fake..!
^"...you won't get away with this..! I can't work with some no good cheat like you- All the lives you've ruined!"
^ I feel something cold against me, My mind goes fuzzy, I can't even think straight anymore.
^"If you don't like it then leave. Leave quietly and your wife can keep her job...Leave peacefully and I won't release any of that little history of yours."
^<I> I lay my head on the desk, newspapers with potential jobs circled in red lay strewn across the table amidsts the empty cans and bottles.
^<I> I can't move, I can't think.
^<I> I don't want too. I try to stop thinking, my own thoughts frighten me. I have nothing left...It's over for me.
^<I> I failed everyone, My wife, my daughter and even my self.
^<I> My reputation was ruined, who would even hire me now?
^<I> I never deserved to be happy.
Drink: ^<I> I can hear rustling outside the door of my office.
DrinkEvenMore: ^<I> Why is everything so damn loud!?
Help: ^"We're leaving..." "But...i wanna say goodbye to dad! Where are we going? Mama?"
^<I> The door slams shut, the house falls quiet. It's for the best, I only hurt them.
^<I> All we did was fight, So I ran away from her.
^<I> The door opens again. Its gentler this time, It doesn't hurt my ears. Has someone broke in?
^<I> I don't bother to check. I can't move even if I wanted too.
^<I> I'm dragged out of the dark office, brought out to the light. It stings my eyes, the friendly face that brought me out here stings them more.
^<I> In the light I know I can't hide, hide how pathetic and useless I've become.
^<I> Please don't look at me. Just put me back...
^<I> It takes time... So much time.
^<I> I lose my home, a lot of my money, my wife and I only see my daughter every other day, but i'm getting there.
^<I> I'm getting better everyday, if not for myself but for my daughter.
^<I> If I wanted to keep seeing her I needed a job first and foremost.
^<I> So we've formed our own detective agency, it's small and people don't trust us yet, but it's enough.
^<I> Somedays are a struggle, but I know I can make it, I have too.
